website_summaries.verdict: Highly regarded by hobbyists, this quality tool is designed for accurate cutting and is easy to operate.
pros: Equipped with a rack and pinion cast-aluminum fence
Pinpoint adjustments and a dozen depth settings
Easy blade change and ergonomic handle
cons: Height adjustments aren't as precise as other models

customer_reviews.title: ... a while before ordering my own and they are pretty comparable. This joiner is a little heavier
customer_reviews.text: I used a friend's DeWalt joiner for a while before ordering my own and they are pretty comparable. This joiner is a little heavier, but feels more powerful. The only two things that I'd say I liked better about the DeWalt was 1) the trigger is more ergonomic on the DeWalt - second nature vs. having to move your hand a bit and 2) the DeWalt doesn't walk down the board as much as this one does. Just make sure you've got a solid hold on the wood and the joiner - you'll be fine. If I had to buy again, I'd go either way - really I'd base my decision on price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K.

customer_reviews.title: I like it best that this tool was very well-made
customer_reviews.text: I like it best that this tool was very well-made. However the instructions were wrong because they instruct one to set the angle guide from the centerline of the blade thickness rather than from the face. I was forced to remove their scale and reinstall it so that it zeroed out in the center of the blade. Apparently Makita is not practicing traditional Japanese kaizen process improvement!
customer_reviews.author: B. Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and no mess!
customer_reviews.text: Rarely do you see a product so well packaged and so simple to use. It comes in a roomy plastic case with metal catches. It is really well designed and assembled. I was using it successfully a few minutes after opening the carton. The dust collection is virtually 100% efficient. There’s no mess at all!! A great product!
customer_reviews.author: GerryR

customer_reviews.title: Stair tread repair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to repair a broken stair tread, having never repaired a stair or used a biscuit joiner, I didn't really know how it would turn out, but the joiner was incredibly easy to use and figure out. I used a size 10 biscuit, I probably should have used the bigger size but the tread looks great and is in better condition than it was. You can adjust height, depth and angle of joiner. Cut was smooth and easy in hard wood.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bushay

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade
customer_reviews.text: As I get more involved with woodworking the more I realize that the right tool makes a world of difference. The Makita plate joiner replaces an inherited older model Craftsman that saw its share of abuse. I was stunned with how smooth this operates. Uniform cut depth and width every time and simple adjustments. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: QMG

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my workshop.
customer_reviews.text: I checked out the DeWalt and PC version prior to my purchase. I liked how the adjestments moved on this Makita a little better. The set-up is as simple as it can be. Cuts are clean and true. Its simple to clean out the machine. I am a deciple of the K.I.S.S school. This model is easy to configure and adjust. I will agree with some other on the bag capacity. If you are making a large number of cuts, hook it up to a vac. The bag fills fast. Nice solid feel. No vibration. Great addition to my workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Detroit

customer_reviews.title: ... it in both my shop and on location with great success. My only complaint is that it does ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this joiner for a few months now and have used it in both my shop and on location with great success. My only complaint is that it does NOT cut a '0' (zero) sized biscuit and I have recently had two situations where I could have used a unit that did; 1/2 inch Baltic birch. The build quality is very good and dust collection was pretty good. Perhaps a very small annoyance was the balance and lack of forward handle to keep it firmly against the edge of the piece being cut.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I usually will buy a super cheap tool - decide if I need it in the shop - wait for it to break - then splurge and buy something like this. Well, this time I skipped all the initial nonsense and went straight for the splurge. I have nothing to compare it to, but man does it eat some wood!! Makes for a quick job when biscuiting. All guides and fences seem to hold well and the ergonomics of it make for super awesome control.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: good machine improved
customer_reviews.text: I own the 3901 and have had it for several years. I have never had any problems with it. I now use it to demo and to let my woodworking students use. The PJ7000 is simply an updated version of the 3901 with a few updates. (l) it runs quieter (2) the brushes are inside the motor housing making it easier to grip (3) the slide rods are chromed and slide a lot easier with less dust accumulation and (4) the depth adjust knob is a lot easier to read. I have never had any problems with Makita products and this one is no exception. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: looseknot

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have around
customer_reviews.text: Have been playing with it on a couple of different projects and really like the extra level of fine finish you get by adding the biscuits. Used it to join drawer fronts to each other to create a door on a dresser I modified to use as a bath vanity/sink piece in the guest bathroom. Turned out great.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Legvold

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic design with intuitive setup & accurate settings.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate and ergonomically designed. Easy and intuitive set up. All the joints I've created with this joined have been right on. I used to always buy Dewalt or Milwaukee tools, but a fabricator I worked with always used Makita because he said the controls were always the right type and always in the right place + the body of Makita tools are smaller (no extra fluff to get a sale), which makes hand held tools easier to control. I still buy Dewalt and Milwaukee when they're cheaper and ergonomics aren't a factor, for everything else, it's Makita.
customer_reviews.author: bano91

customer_reviews.title: Should have got one sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. I build cabinets and find myself reaching for it with pleasure. I do like the fence better than the Dewalt I used about 15 years ago. Be careful where you set it, The cord goes staight out the back and can hang in your walking space. I tripped on the cord, jerked mine off the table, and broke the fence. Replacement parts were surprisingly reasonable. Now I set it down on the floor when not in use. If the fence gets a little sticky use wax. Also I like the way the fence tilts 45 degrees, joints with this toy turn out great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Champ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Works the way it suppose to work.
customer_reviews.text: Ignore all the internet reviews that show the fence moving while you lock it. it does not. Locks right and the fence does not move anywhere. Does the job well and has power to spare. Dust collector sucks when used without vacuum, but that is not a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Julio C. Oyarzabal

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool, poor sawdust connection
customer_reviews.text: Typical Makita product. Well made and works well. Comes in a great storage case. Only downside is that the sawdust chute clogs all of the time. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to use and easy to set up for different cuts. Makita has an excellent reputation and I have a Makita 4 inch grinder that's about 30 years old..... still running great!
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur C. Carruth

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my tired and worn out Freud biscuit jointer. I am not disappointed at all. Excellent ergonomics , smooth operation and adjustments. This is a very well made tool and an excellent addition to any cabinet maker or home hobbyist. Comes with a molded plastic storage case.
customer_reviews.author: William Dobbins

customer_reviews.title: Great design and value.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent feel, accuracy, and simplistic design. The only (minor) detail I wish were different is the attachment of the catcher. It rotates a bit too easy. Although the actual fit it firm and I suspect as I maneuver the tool more I’ll be glad it rotates with ease (?).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best plate joiner for the money
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally smooth. Permits the ability to nearly free hand making cuts. Nice, quality fence with useful features. You would have to spend hundreds of dollars more (buying the original Swiss machine) to even find its equal. Shockingly good value.
customer_reviews.author: Neal W.

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and Fast!
customer_reviews.text: This biscuit cutter works great very accurate on cuts and cuts are smooth when finished. All the Makita tools I own always work great and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon CustomerPaul H.

customer_reviews.title: Best Plate Joiner on the market
customer_reviews.text: Could not be more satisfied with this tool. It's accurate, cuts cleanly and easy to operate. Gets my highest rating and absolutely no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: One Pony Show

customer_reviews.title: High Quality biscuit joiner
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this joiner for several months. Used it to build several projects. It is the first biscuit joiner I've owned, so I can't compare it to others. It works as advertised with no problems. Cutting and dust collection are excellent. One thing I would mention is the on/off button. A fellow woodworker owns a dewalt. He used the makita and did not like the on/off button position.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Well made and accurate joiner
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why I didn't buy one sooner. I've used this to make vanity cabinets for a master bath remodel... and a huge set of cabinets for built-in storage. Couldn't be easier to lay out or use the tool. Perfect joints every time. The dust bag works well, but be sure to empty it before you think it's full or you will have shavings packed so tightly around the blade and in the base/housing that you'll need to clean them out with a piece of wire before anything will flow!
customer_reviews.author: RickyB

customer_reviews.title: Makita quality control screwed the pooch
customer_reviews.text: Recieved total piece of garbage. Motor gave out on the first cut. It is now a $170 paperweight and I have to wait another two weeks for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: chauncey gray

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: It works great fast and right on the money very tight fit with the biscuits
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed. Easy to handle. Smooth cut. little loud. I am reducing one star due to dust collection. collection bag is waste of money. Clogs in a minutes. If you don't empty, it will start clogging inside joiner and will affect cut quality. Using without collection bag is not a good idea as it spread dust all over the work area. I am thinking of connecting it shop-vac but not spend time in getting right connectors and small pipe fittings.
customer_reviews.author: New Found Hobby

customer_reviews.title: If you are like me and own only Makita products and want to ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality Plate Joiner. This model is also assembled in USA. If you are like me and own only Makita products and want to cut down on the dust, order the Makita 192108-A hose also on Amazon, it plugs into the Plate Joiner and all the newer model Makita hand sanders.
customer_reviews.author: joshua whaley

customer_reviews.title: No FF
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I dislike is it does not do FF biscuts. If it had that option would be 5*
customer_reviews.author: Frank B

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband since he has started getting into woodworking. He is excited to use it
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to figure out
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly easy to figure out. We spent probably 5 minutes twiddling with knobs and moving pieces and then got right to cutting.
customer_reviews.author: A. Veres

customer_reviews.title: Great quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Works fluidly and reliably, and for provided spot on biscuit joints, very satisfied. Hope to have many years of use out of this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew F

customer_reviews.title: Love it when I ordered it I dident know it ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it when I ordered it I dident know it came With a case very happy it did it gives me peice of mind it won’t get banged around as much as if I were to Put it in a bag
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Very sharp blade and very powerful motor
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Very sharp blade and very powerful motor. Lots of nice features. Way better than my Black and Decker but like comparing apples to oranges. This baby is worth the little extra cash. Does a good job with all hard woods.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Little tricky to adjust but much better results than the porter cable and this doesn't make grinding motor noises like the porter cable.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: You don't know how often you need it until you start playing with it
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a while, then looked at other models. It's amazing how flimsy the other fences were compared to the Makita. If you're on the fence about buying one for a single job, you'd be amazed at how often you'll find uses for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted to own this tool and time came. Quality product can't wait to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel Nesterov

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. Easy to use,. Only issue, shavings bag fills fast, have to empty after 15 to 20 cuts. No big deal. Price good, delivery on time. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Frenette

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: Easy and accurate. Super simple to adjust to the application. A good tool at a good price. I use it in my home shop...non commercial. Highly recommended. Makita makes great tools.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Iadone

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing. I usually buy Makita or Milwaukee
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. I usually buy Makita or Milwaukee. This thing is great. If you plan on doing alot of buiscuit joining I highly recommend this tool. Definitely built for frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good power and handling, height adjustment could have been better
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: First biscuit joiner I've owned. Super simple, with settings for most of the major biscuit sizes. I had immediate use for it and it made super quick work of the joints. Seems very well built.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kuehn

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect-Almost
customer_reviews.text: This is a good biscuit joiner. The other reviewers who notice the clogged chute for debris are right. I cut roughly 7 biscuit grooves in a piece of pine board and the chute was plugged up. It is something Makita needs to pay attention to and fix, in my opinion. Otherwise I like the smooth operation of the joiner. I have had other brands, and this one is the easiest to use and hold onto.
customer_reviews.author: Bob T.

customer_reviews.title: Best tool for the job in this price range.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the fit and finish of this tool, well engineered, does what it’s supposed to do. I have used several other brands in this price range over the last few years and this Makita is far and away the best.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Croley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Powerful motor makes the process very easy. This is a very comfortable tool to use!
customer_reviews.author: Breeze Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I only used it few times. The tool seems super sturdy, the case it comes with is great and not bulky like some of the Milwaukee tool cases. It seems accurate but I haven't done much work to prove that nor if it's going to stand up to the time test. So far I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Arek Kosinski

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to handle.Settings are easy to work with. Motor seems strained under heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Skip the rest and just get this one!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. Works very well and is simple to use, even for a newbie.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Cabinet making will never be the same.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first biscuit joiner... and it's amazing! So easy to use. It makes very clean cuts and any depth you desire for making biscuit cuts. I'm very pleased with the tool itself AND the carry/storage case. Great product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: coryalex

customer_reviews.title: Great joiner
customer_reviews.text: Joiner works great. Other one I used was porter cable and like this one a lot better. Adjusts easy and accurate and has plenty of power.very easy to line up with mark
customer_reviews.author: Raymond J. Penot

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Pros Good adjustments, sturdy, easy to handle, quet, cuts clean nice slots. It is a good tool if you are handy and know how to get around. Some small features are realy nice. Cons. Dust collecting spout is falling out. The dust exhaust window was easily plugged with the oak shavings. Need to clean the dust bag after 2-3 slots or connect the vaccum with a good suction. The offset scale on the plate is way too coarse to use as a reference and is misaligned. So the it is pretty much useless. Plastic adapter is a junk.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Typically Makita Quality
customer_reviews.text: Well I ordered what I thought was the 240v version and got what I expected, the 120v version. Amazon agreed to the return however upon investigation I found that even when I purchased a 240v - 120v transformer for this unit I was still ahead 25% on what I could have purchased it for locally. And now I have a transformer for all the other 120v tools I may buy from amazon. I have used the jointer a few times now just mucking around and I cant really fault it. Clean, quick, accurate. 5 stars from me
customer_reviews.author: Damien OL

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tool. All cast aluminum construction with fast action adjustment knobs and clamps make this an accurate and easy cutter to use. You could get a biscuit joiner cheaper but spend the money and get a tool of this quality and you'll be happy for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: HO

customer_reviews.title: It's great. I had the porter cable but now I ...
customer_reviews.text: It's great. I had the porter cable but now I have this one and IMO this one is better. I haven't had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Makita Plate Joiner is Great
customer_reviews.text: Makita plate joiner rated well. I've never used one, so I can't compare, but this one works very well for me. It's small and light. It cuts nice biscuit slots. What else could I ask?
customer_reviews.author: John R. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and gives great results
customer_reviews.text: Man oh man. My eyes are open wide now that I have this joiner. Easy to use and gives great results.
customer_reviews.author: AmateurbyDesign

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to install a Mahogany Deck. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love every inch of the joiner, Quite, accurate and beautiful
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: This tool is very easy to use and will make short work of using ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool is very easy to use and will make short work of using biscuits to join your wooden workpieces. It is adjustable for the 0, 10 and 20 size biscuits for sure and I have not used other sizes and do not even know if there are any others.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product worked as described, did the job for what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: CP Tech

customer_reviews.title: Joiner
customer_reviews.text: Never had a biscuit joiner before. Although it will take some getting used to, it works great! I do wish the instructions were a little more clear. The printing is a little smudged.
customer_reviews.author: Mayday

customer_reviews.title: I can say it worked great!
customer_reviews.text: New to bisquit jointing and after finishing my first project (4 ft tall solid old bookshelf) using this new tool, I can say it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Createaneutron

customer_reviews.title: Makita hasn't let me down yet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this plate joiner! My only complaint is that even though the bag picks up all of the shavings until it's full, when it does get full, unclogging the shavings from the tool itself is a tedious journey.
customer_reviews.author: Kucero

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: professional carpenter for 15 years. Love this tool. easy to use and works great.
customer_reviews.author: tim gates

customer_reviews.title: going to last for years
customer_reviews.text: Great product this plate joiner going to last for years it fell off my work bench didn't even have a scratch cut smooth like I said it's going to be the last one you buy great product
customer_reviews.author: curtis-dallas tx

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good joiner and very easy to use and to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Perry G.

customer_reviews.title: Makita PJ700 Biscuit Joiner
customer_reviews.text: This is a great joiner. Makita makes great tools and is consistently a leader among its competitors. Although Makita tends to be a little pricier - their products are almost always of exceptional quality. Bought my first Makita woodworking tool over 30 years ago and it still works great. This Biscuit Joiner is well made and feels very solid. Very stable when operating with easy to use controls. The only other Biscuit Joiner models I considered buying was Porter-Cable and Dewalt. But chose the Makita based on other reviews because of its fence being the most stable. And it costs a little less than Porter-Cable's good model.
customer_reviews.author: Red Ram

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice and useful tool when needed. Not something that I will use every day, but when you need it, it will be there.
customer_reviews.author: copper 1795

customer_reviews.title: Fab plate joiner
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product: performs precisely as needed. Good quality Makita engineering.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: The best jointed. Expensive, but worth it. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JFH

customer_reviews.title: Great biscuit joiner!
customer_reviews.text: Great joiner, very smooth fence, cuts with ease! Highly recomended!
customer_reviews.author: Yanchi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Far superior to the Grizzly model bought, and generally I love Grizzly products, but more expensive too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Bisuits for all!
customer_reviews.text: Love this biscuit joiner, solid feel, does precisely was it is supposed to!
customer_reviews.author: David A. Bartels

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality powerful tool. I used it to biscut joint two pieces of oak for a window seat and the bond was true and strong. I recomend this for the DIYers out there and the pros
customer_reviews.author: David C. Andronico

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate, reliable power tool. Like this better than PC. Will buy more of these when needed at our shop.
customer_reviews.author: bigjohn66

customer_reviews.title: its action is easy and smooth
customer_reviews.text: i have only used it for ext trim . its action is easy and smooth . don't yet know how accurate .
customer_reviews.author: Erik Bender

customer_reviews.title: does the trick
customer_reviews.text: Having gone many years without a biscut joiner, I am very happy with this machine. Much quicker, easier and safer than my hand-held router set-up. Easy to use and and easy to adjust. Nicely made. Consistent with high quality of all Makita power tools. Came with a practical case, large enough to actually store the unit without having to fight the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Finbar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and powerful enough for any hardwoods.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Lumpkin

customer_reviews.title: Makita PJ7000 Plate Joiner
customer_reviews.text: Top machine,so easy to use and great value for money. Had to use a 240/120 transformer for New Zealand power rating but that was no drama...it does a great job, clean and accurate...very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: A H HOUSE

customer_reviews.title: Joiner of precise and awesome workmanship.
customer_reviews.text: THis is an awesome tool easy to use precise and clean. My only dislike is the dust bag could be a bit larger as I am working with many planks of wood and have to change it often. I would recommend it over almost any tool in its category and price range.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good tool. Well made, plenty of power, enough features, easy to handle, good price point.
customer_reviews.author: David J Kingfish

customer_reviews.title: $151 in June 2014
customer_reviews.text: Bought this joiner on Amazon in June 2014 when the price was $151.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Easy to use and does a great job. I would buy it again..
customer_reviews.author: Magnum

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Why I didn't purchase this sooner. Aids in panel alignment and all aspects of jointing.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Ondrak

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: It was the first time for my using one of these tools. The instructions were clear and it worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Joiner
customer_reviews.text: My first joiner so I may not be the ideal person to answer the question. it was packed well, worked straight out of the box, so I am happy still learning the ways to use the tool, well made, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommended.. =) im really happy with
customer_reviews.text: What a machine!.. 100% recommended.. =) im really happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a biscuit joiner. Read the reviews on Amazon and ordered it. It came in two days! (Oh, how I love Amazon shipping.) I immediately put it to use. In less than 30 minutes (including reading all the instructions) I was up and running. It is easy to operate and does exactly what I wanted it to do. Can't ask for much more.
customer_reviews.author: OceanCruiser13

customer_reviews.title: Makita Biscuit Joiner
customer_reviews.text: This tool is definately well thought out and well built. I replaced a Porter Cable Biscuit Joiner with this Makita and very glad I did. I like holding and pushing from the center of the machine instead of the very back as with the Porter Cable. Makita gives you a more balance control with the cut. Another Makita Great!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Guffey

customer_reviews.title: Good biscuit cutter. There may be better designs out there, however.
customer_reviews.text: I really like Makita products. This biscuit cutter does the job well. Because of the sloppy way in which to adjust the up and down movement, it can be a bit challenging to get exactly in the center of a board.
customer_reviews.author: J. West

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality item. It was transported to Mexico with great speed and arrived in great condition. Thanks a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: can't imagine any way to improve this tool. it's simply perfect, no lie.
customer_reviews.text: a light, perfectly balanced tool that does its job quietly and accurately. plate joiners are very versatile, and this is the best one I've ever used. I've been a cabinetmaker for 20 years, and used several other brands, but this new model simply is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Tool
customer_reviews.text: Very well thought out and easy to use. Well balanced. I cant believe it took me so long to buy one. The price was great to.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Bashaw

customer_reviews.title: Besides the narrow exhaust port, a solid tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great little plate joiner. It's easy to dial in your cuts, and it chews through any woods you can throw at it. My one complaint is that the exhaust port can clog fairly easily, making for a bit of a messy work area as the shavings end up being ejected out of the front. It's easy to get unclogged, it's just always annoying to have to stop working to tweak one of your tools.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Harms

customer_reviews.title: Good for tables
customer_reviews.text: I make small tables as a hobby since I retired along with other things. I have a lot of Makita tools and find them to be very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: doglover116

customer_reviews.title: Makita PJ7000 Plate Joiner
customer_reviews.text: I'm a first time user of a (any) plate joiner (biscuit joiner). If you just read the directions & exercise some safe handling, using this tool could not be easier ... makes you feel like you've been using it for 20 years. It is a ~very~ high quality tool, and produces absolutely capital results. Period.
customer_reviews.author: Mike, Austin, TX

customer_reviews.title: MAKITA pj7000 Plarte Jointer
customer_reviews.text: This product was every thing I expected and then some it works great and is very easy to set up and use I used it right out of the box thank you ED.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makita Biscuit cutter
customer_reviews.text: This is what I've been needing for a long time. It works good and I would recomend it to a friend.

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: the new makita joiner is very nice and smooth. quality built was the first thing that went through my head when i held it. nice cam adjustments and very smooth action. if your looking for a joiner this is the one to get
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes it and it works well, no issues.

customer_reviews.title: It's worth having a biscuit jointer.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a handy tool to add to my shop. I have struggled with cutting a biscuit on a table saw miter.

customer_reviews.title: solid
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. solid and accurate, unlike dewalts version which i returned.
customer_reviews.author: James Wood

product_meta.title: Makita PJ7000 Plate Joiner
product_meta.description:
The Makita Plate Joiner (model PJ7000), combines power and precision with ease-of-use features for strong and accurate biscuit joints for furniture making, cabinet construction and fine woodworking applications.

The PJ7000 has powerful 5.6 AMP motor with 11,000 RPM for quick and precise cutting in a variety of woods. The rack-and-pinion vertical fence system is engineered for accurate fence adjustments, and the cast aluminum pivot fence has three positive stops at 0 degrees, 45 degrees, and 90 degrees. The blade diameter is 4 inches with a maximum cutting depth of ¾ inches, and there are six depth settings with one-touch stops for the most common biscuit sizes including #0, #10 and #20.

The non-marring rubber inserts on the shoe are engineered to prevent material from slipping, and the “tool-less” blade cover and shaft lock allow for easy blade changes. Additional features include easy-to-operate cam locks for quick fence adjustments, a large top grip handle for improved handling, and a slim ergonomic body design.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Makita's new PJ7000 Plate Joiner has an aluminum front body for added durability. It also has a toolless blade cover and shaft lock for fast and easy blade changes.
feature_bullets: Powerful 5.6 AMP motor delivers 11,000 RPM for quick, precise cutting in a variety of woods
Cast aluminum pivot fence with three positive stops at 0°, 45° and 90°
Six depth settings with one-touch stops for most common biscuits sizes including #0, #10, and #20
Large and easy-to-operate cam locks for angle guide and fence adjustments
Rack-and-pinion vertical fence system engineered for accurate fence adjustments
Powerful 5.6 AMP motor with delivers 11,000 RPM
Cast pivot fence with three positive stops
